Class Game

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.World
      Game

public class Game
extends greenfoot.World

This world class is the class that represents the game level. Most the of game logic is contained here.

Version:
January 5, 2015
Author:
Tiger Zhao

act method for the class Game This method is continuously run.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.World

canMoveDown

public boolean canMoveDown(int y)
This method checks if the player can move the current block down.

Parameters:
y - the height of the block to check from

canMoveLeft

public boolean canMoveLeft()
This method checks whether or not the block can move left

canMoveRight

public boolean canMoveRight()
This method checks whether or not the block can move right

canRotateLeft

public boolean canRotateLeft()
This method checks whether or not the block can rotate left.

canRotateRight

public boolean canRotateRight()
This method checks whether or not the block can rotate right.

checkLose

public void checkLose()
This method checks if the player has lost

clearLines

public void clearLines()
This method checks to see if any lines can be cleared and then clears them. Score is added accordingly. This method is only run every time the player places a block.

controlMovement

public void controlMovement()
This method allows for the player to provide input.

drawScreen

public void drawScreen()
This method updates the game screen. It refreshes the blocks so that the game is playable.

drawShadow

public void drawShadow()
This method draws the shadow of the current block

generateBlocks

public void generateBlocks()
This method generates blocks. It randomly chooses between the 7 possible tetris pieces and adds it to the blocks coming up.

getNextBlock

public void getNextBlock()
This method gets the next block in line and keeps a constant number of blocks coming up.

moveAllDown

public void moveAllDown()
This method instantly drops the current block to the bottom and sets it in place. This is called when the user presses space.

rotateLeft

public void rotateLeft()
This method rotates the current block left.

rotateRight

public void rotateRight()
This method rotates the current block right.

setInBlock

public void setInBlock()
This method takes the current block and "sets it in". It addes the current block to the main array that holds all the tetris block. Onces set in, the player can no longer control this block
